title: Yorick Mori Remembered AF Dev Team Q&A [NOW COMPLETE]
body:
http://i.imgur.com/vLHENH1.jpg

YORICK REWORK Q&A IS NOW COMPLETE. Some of us will pop back in when we can to answer follow-up questions, but the main Q&A has concluded. Thanks for participating!

This Q&A hosted by:

Alex _"Riot Ranger XIV"_ Sherrell - **QA Analyst**
Sol _"Solcrushed"_ Kim - **Gameplay**
Brian _"Bitsplosion"_ Thompson - **VFX artist**
John _"JohnODyin"_ O'Bryan - **Narrative**
Ryan _"Cactopus"_ Rigney - **Publishing**
Kory _"Ququroon"_ Dearborne - **QA Analyst**
Larry _"Riot LegendLarry"_ Colvin - **Art Outsourcing**
Christopher _"Riot Rainslight"_ Eaton - **Gameplay Video**
Gem _"Lonewingy"_ Lim - **Concept Artist**

replies.body:
Now that Yorick is done and skins can now be made: Crazy Cat Lady Yorick? 


Ok real questions: 

1) What was the hardest part to animated? The graves? The cape? The Maiden? 

2) Any hilarious bugs during testing?

> [{quoted}](name=lightdragoon88,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:10:23.821+0000)
>
> Now that Yorick is done and skins can now be made: Crazy Cat Lady Yorick? 

oh, god, yes! this is one of those perfect april 1st joke skins like banana raka or meowkai.
I will go on record saying I am big fan of the Crazy Cat Lady skin idea.
Seconded, that shit is dank
Choo choo, let's get this train going! Thirded!
http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/facebook/000/523/870/628

But where does Yorick fall in that skin now that there is the maiden of the mist? Would she be the crazy cat lady, or a giant cat? Make Yorick wear a cat furry costume? Crazy cat couple? Yorick has a kitty poop scoop is a given I guess.

> [{quoted}](name=Aries Burst,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=0007000000000002,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:59:52.255+0000)
>
> But where does Yorick fall in that skin now that there is the maiden of the mist? Would she be the crazy cat lady, or a giant cat? Make Yorick wear a cat furry costume? Crazy cat couple? Yorick has a kitty poop scoop is a given I guess.

Hmm. Personally, gun to my head, I'd make Yorick an old lady with shawl, covered in cat hair. Keep the scooper! That's gold.

The Maiden is a giant evil wraith-cat.
Far and away the best bug for me (on playtest) was whenever I summoned Yorick it would cause the game to crash for one other person in the game. It was like some sick game of russian roulette.

> [{quoted}](name=Cezium,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=00070003,timestamp=2016-09-06T19:30:15.785+0000)
>
> Far and away the best bug for me (on playtest) was whenever I summoned Yorick it would cause the game to crash for one other person in the game. It was like some sick game of russian roulette.

The bug where Yorick's ghouls were mini yoricks was pretty good

1) The caaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaape. Our animators are triggered to this day whenever we mention the thing

2) We had a bug where the Maiden and the ghouls would march 'across' the middle of the map in Twisted Treeline, and I could not for the life of me figure out why the AI was behaving that way.

It turned out that TT has a 'mid lane' that connects both nexuses in the game logic. So my AI for 'go down nearest lane' was causing them to go down this 'mid lane'

> [{quoted}](name=Solcrushed,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=00070001,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:13:59.862+0000)
>
> 1) The caaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaape. Our animators are triggered to this day whenever we mention the thing
> 
> 2) We had a bug where the Maiden and the ghouls would march 'across' the middle of the map in Twisted Treeline, and I could not for the life of me figure out why the AI was behaving that way.
> 
> It turned out that TT has a 'mid lane' that connects both nexuses in the game logic. So my AI for 'go down nearest lane' was causing them to go down this 'mid lane'

Yeah, that cape was a lot of work for a lot of people.
Nah, #2 is just thematic. The black mist was spreading.

Skins Team has been giving us some looks... 

As for bugs, a lot of them were around interactions with ghouls/wall with other champions, but none of those are funny. There was a pretty interesting one where Yorick's Q2 didn't actually consume the graves, so he could just keep mashing Q over and over to spawn new ghouls.
Okay, so real talk.  Is the Maiden of the Mists Nocturne's mommy?

> [{quoted}](name=Grylos,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=0082,timestamp=2016-09-06T19:30:48.635+0000)
>
> Okay, so real talk.  Is the Maiden of the Mists Nocturne's mommy?

I hope not. That would mean they can't be a couple.
Would you call this a Mist Opportunity?

> [{quoted}](name=Ququroon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=008200000001,timestamp=2016-09-06T19:48:08.371+0000)
>
> Would you call this a Mist Opportunity?

No!

> [{quoted}](name=JohnODyin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=00820000,timestamp=2016-09-06T19:31:42.894+0000)
>
> I hope not. That would mean they can't be a couple.


...I SHIP IT.

> [{quoted}](name=Grylos,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=008200000000,timestamp=2016-09-06T19:43:42.600+0000)
>
> ...I SHIP IT.

hahaha. Canon.
Why did you guys decide to not-give his Mistwankers a face/empty eye sockets or something?

Long answer: The concept for mist walkers is supposedly the twisted beings blinded through hunger and  hatred, they don't have any humane values or consciousness all they know is to bite, scratch and devour anyone who's in front of them. That's why in game, Yorick has very little control over them.
Short answer: because they will look like minions from "Despicable Me" if they have eyes.

The only thing that everyone wants

"You will remember Yorick Mori"
The quote 'Remember me, for I no longer will someday' (Can't recall the precise quote) is intended to be an homage to his iconic line.
"Remember my name, for someday I may not"
Thanks for the assist!
http://s2.quickmeme.com/img/4e/4e7c4fec1974025c4aeae464c3f566df46c55a3bff664ac3afb28164535db7b8.jpg
What's pst?
It's the sound you make when you want to whisper to someone.
Nono, it's Please Send Tell, when somebody wants to buy/sell something in Trade Chat.
wait, people do more in tradechat than spam thunderfury? what game are you even talking about
I mean, I could have been talking about many games, but now we're talking about [Thunderfury, Blessed Blade of the Windseeker]

So when did you decide to change his minion mechanic to a passive rather than have them be separate abilities?

And why remove his lantern?  I imagine it was an iconic part of him.

I can answer about the lantern thing. We did try include the lantern but took it out because it's starting to clutter his story and thematic. He has 2 new visual key which is his black mist cape and the water vial on his necklace. Adding the lantern on top of those is too much already. Besides, I think Thresh is the lantern champ :3

> [{quoted}](name=lonewingy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:14:27.421+0000)
>
> Besides, I think Thresh is the lantern champ :3

Didn't Yorick have it first?  By _years_?
It's either the shovel or the lantern? Who gets chopped?

> [{quoted}](name=lonewingy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:31:14.219+0000)
>
> It's either the shovel or the lantern? Who gets chopped?

Geez, if the choice was that forced... :/  I would have hoped that this team was creative enough to come with a solution that would have worked, but given how much I've been directly crapped on by Riot staff since this rework was announced, I should expect such harshness.
Haha XD lantern turns into vial ;) I thought you guys will notice when you check out his Undertaker skin. Supposedly a surprise!
But why the water vial?  It doesn't really do anything in game.
The water vial is mainly for narrative piece, so was the lantern. But water vial can tell deeper stories about Yorick and the Shadow Isles. Lantern is only there because of the Gravedigger trope.
I always thought that the vial was sort of the new lantern for his design. Though that's just an assumption on my part. I never actually asked Lonewingy if that was true or not lol.

Rather early, as we felt one of the issues with 'old' Yorick was that his summons felt like afterthoughts to a spell. Since we wanted to refocus the character around his minions, making them their own thing made a lot of sense.

Obviously we want the best bug from this.

Maybe the most insane version of his kit.

I had a version where the Mist Walkers were unlimited & the ult caused all dead enemy units during a time frame to become Mist Walkers.

Anyone with a skillshot was unplayable.

A fun version of his kit was when he had % missing health healing on his Q (like 5% of his missing health) that basically caused him to be unkillable without some serious burst damage. I remember getting into a fight against Udyr and between his turle shield and my Q we actually couldn't really kill each other although both of us started the fight at under 20% health.

Then there was that combined with low ratios and pretty high bases - we basically had Yorick suicide splitting down a lane and it would take 2-3+ people to kill him because he would build entirely tank items. He didn't have enough damage to kill anyone else, but he was very capable of slowing killing towers. There were too many games where he was 0-10 and still won just because he was in the game. It didn't even matter what happened anywhere else. I commonly refer to this as the worst week of playtesting ever lol =P

I remember Solcrushed saying on the Yorick stream that there used to not be a limit on his minions. Apparently in one of the playtests there was a wave of Yorick minions that was 40 strong, or something ridiculous like that. They changed that shortly after.

Semi-serious questions:

• Is Riot still blaming _players_ for Old  Yorick's lack of popularity (that he's a gravedigger and ugly instead of Riot never giving the champion any real support after launch?)

• Why another monk as we already have Udyr and Lee Sin, (along with the four ninjas, Karma and Master Yi)?

• Why does New Yorick look like the WWE Undertaker, circa the "Ministry of Darkness" era?

Serious questions:

• Who is the voice actor for New Yorick?  (I've heard Keith David and Jim Cummings, but both are priced too high for Riot's usual VO budget.)

• What is the reasoning behind the lack of control over the ghouls?

• When will we see this new expanded lore for New Yorick?  Is this going to go with the next installment of the current tale (post "Shadow and Fortune")?

• Was New Yorick intended for other roles other than top lane split pushing?

• Should we expect something this drastic to Galio when this team gets around to reworking him?  Should Galio fans fear the same sort of complete dismantling of their favorite champ as well?

• With all the changes to the original champion, why wasn't a Traditional skin considered for those of us who will miss the green guy?

> [{quoted}](name=TerraRising,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:21:15.663+0000)
> 
> • Is Riot still blaming _players_ for Old  Yorick's lack of popularity (that he's a gravedigger and ugly instead of Riot never giving the champion any real support after launch?)

Seriously great questions in here. I wrote the champ reveal, so I'll take this one! I focused on the problems with his theme (creepy old gravedigger) in his reveal because I think theme is a really powerful factor in whether or not champions are popular. Obviously Yorick had other problems, and we didn't give him the attention he deserved. I think we feel pretty confident saying that we screwed up with the original design—his play pattern was flawed at its very core, and so we found ourself just making sure he sat close to a 50% winrate rather than trying to fix it with a torrent of changes. 

That, honestly, is not a good way to keep League healthy. We realized that—this is one of the big reasons we started pouring serious resources into the Champion Update team(s). Sometimes changes to one or two abilities isn't enough to make a champ healthy, and we've gotta put more resources into it. You guys are right to hold us accountable when we let champs languish in an unhealthy state. Champ Update exists to make those champs better. Sometimes it takes us a while, but I think we're getting better at it.

Gonna have to leave for a bit. I'm very busy helping to plan Ryze's next three reworks. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

> [{quoted}](name=TerraRising,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:21:15.663+0000)
>
> Semi-serious questions:
> 
> • Is Riot still blaming _players_ for Old  Yorick's lack of popularity (that he's a gravedigger and ugly instead of Riot never giving the champion any real support after launch?)
> 
> • Why another monk as we already have Udyr and Lee Sin, (along with the four ninjas, Karma and Master Yi)?
> 
> • Why does New Yorick look like the WWE Undertaker, circa the "Ministry of Darkness" era?
> 
> Serious questions:
> 
> • Who is the voice actor for New Yorick?  (I've heard Keith David and Jim Cummings, but both are priced too high for Riot's usual VO budget.)
> 
> • What is the reasoning behind the lack of control over the ghouls?
> 
> • When will we see this new expanded lore for New Yorick?  Is this going to go with the next installment of the current tale (post "Shadow and Fortune")?
> 
> • Was New Yorick intended for other roles other than top lane split pushing?
> 
> • Should we expect something this drastic to Galio when this team gets around to reworking him?  Should Galio fans fear the same sort of complete dismantling of their favorite champ as well?
> 
> • With all the changes to the original champion, why wasn't a Traditional skin considered for those of us who will miss the green guy?

Re: lack of control -- thematically, Yorick does not think of himself as enslaving the souls in his mist. He thinks what someone like Thresh does is pretty abhorrent. Yorick likes to give the things he summons some agency so he can feel better about himself.

> [{quoted}](name=JohnODyin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAATvLlB,comment-id=00120000,timestamp=2016-09-06T18:25:35.440+0000)
>
> Re: lack of control -- thematically, Yorick does not think of himself as enslaving the souls in his mist. He thinks what someone like Thresh does is pretty abhorrent. Yorick likes to give the things he summons some agency so he can feel better about himself.

Yet, he is called the "Shepherd of Lost Souls."  A shepherd needs control over his flock, lest he lose them.

In this instance, wouldn't a better term be "Wrangler" or "Gatherer?"
